action.name: Change Shape (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Ishilla magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 5 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 7 hours. Ishilla can choose whether her equipment falls to the ground, melds with her new form, or is worn by the new form. Ishilla reverts to her true form if she dies or falls {@condition unconscious}. Ishilla can revert to her true form using a bonus action on her turn.

While in a new form, Ishilla retains her game statistics and ability to speak, but her AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and she gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that she lacks. She can cast her spells with verbal or somatic components in her new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

Aarakocra range the Howling Gyre, an endless storm of mighty winds and lashing rains that surrounds the tranquil realm of Aaqa in the Elemental Plane of Air. Making aerial patrols, these birdlike humanoids guard the windy borders of their home against invaders from the Elemental Plane of Earth, such as gargoyles, their sworn enemies.

entries.name: Enemies of Elemental Evil
entries: In service to the Wind Dukes of Aaqa, aarakocra scout the planes in search of temples of Elemental Evil. They spy on malign elemental creatures and then either take the fight to those creatures or report back to the Wind Dukes.

On the Material Plane, aarakocra create aeries atop the highest mountains, especially peaks near portals to the Elemental Plane of Air. From such heights, aarakocra watch for signs of elemental incursions, as well as for nascent threats to their home plane. Aarakocra prefer to live their lives like the wind-unburdened and ever moving-yet they watch over a region for years if that's what it takes to guard against the incursions of Elemental Evil.

Aarakocra have no concept of political borders or property ownership, and the value of gems, gold, and other precious materials means little to aarakocra. In their eyes, a creature should use what is necessary and then cast what is left on the wind for others to use.

entries.name: Search for the Seven Shards
entries: The Wind Dukes of Aaqa come from a race of elemental beings called the vaati, which once ruled many worlds. A creature known as the Queen of Chaos arose and initiated an interplanar war against vaati rule. To combat the threat, seven vaati heroes combined their powers to create the mighty {@i Rod of Law}. In a battle against the queen's greatest general, Mishka the Wolf Spider, a vaati killed Mishka by thrusting the rod into him like a spear. The rod shattered into seven shards that scattered across the multiverse. Aaracokra seek signs of the pieces' locations in order to rebuild what is now known as the {@i Rod of Seven Parts}.

entries.name: Summoning Air Elementals
entries: Five aarakocra within 30 feet of each other can magically summon an air elemental. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain concentration while doing so (as if concentrating on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within 5 feet of it can return with it.

The Stormcast clan is renowned and well respected throughout the Kingdom of the Snowy Mountains and beyond, as an ancient line of wizards and royal advisors, despite their diminished importance since the incorporation of Skuriamania into the Teolian Empire.
They are also among the wealthiest in the Kingdom, conjointly owning a large number of businesses and private residences throughout it.
Born ?. Backstory:

My name is Tonka Twofoot, and I'm a proud Goof Halfling born in the surroundings of Halfling Port. I come from a long lineage of Twofoots, a name as old as the first halflings, who have always had two feet and always put them to great use.

From a very young age, I showed a natural attunement to the flows of magic and a particular interest in wildlife and the cycles of nature. During my childhood I spent most of my time wandering the wilderness and studying all sorts of different creatures. I often found myself more at home close to the ant colonies and sheep herds of Hillsea than next to my own kin.

In my early adulthood, I put my skills as a budding young wizard to use, trying to help the community in various ways. After some time, my family and friends got together and gathered enough money to send me on a one way trip to Teolia Major, where I was accepted into the Wizard Academy to develop my magical talents.

On my fifth year at the Wizard Academy, I made my first major contribution to the scientific community by proving that Magmin taste buds are extremely, violently, and explosively reactive to measures of over 2 grams of Orihalcum. That also coincided with my expulsion from the academy for "reckless endangerment of fellow students" and "irrepairable damage to study hall".

Ever since then, I have been travelling the world working on my lifelong dream of writing the most complete encylopedia of species of Teolia. During my travels I've been face to face with all manners of life forms, including a visit from a Fey and a brief stay in the Feywild.
Currently, I am in the Snowy Mountains with my good friend and former colleague Khagdurm, who has offered me a place to stay while I study the vast underground fauna and flora of the Snowy Mountains.
